result.execSummary:
The defendant Trayvon D Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable, mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge; to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due & owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant remanded into custody.
*9/1/2015 credit amended to 63 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain employment. 
Obtain GED or HSED.
Be given job and vocational training.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he cannot possess any firearms and is further advised of voting ineligibilty

NO CONTACT with victims, Monica L., Anthony W., Trevion B.
NO CONTACT with co-actors, Dashod Crutchfield, and Dvontay Goodwin. 
NO alcohol;  NO controlled substances.

Provide DNA sample.  
Pay all Supervision fees.   
Mental Health assessment; treatment if needed.  
Participate in Anger Management counseling.  
Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.

AODA assessment; treatment if neeed.  
Urine screens.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Torbenson in trial in Branch 40.  Parties select a new date.  File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request to allow defendant's case 15CF1222 currently before Branch 02 to proceed with this case.  Clerk contacted Branch 02 who did not object.  Court granted request for adjournment and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
PSI mailed on today's date to ADA Torbenson and Attorney Epps.

Received and filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Count 2.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed but read in.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3 AND 4:  
Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information of Counts 1, 3 and 4 and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. Defense counsel requested a presentence report with no recommendation.  Court granted defense request and ordered same.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 6/05/15 at 8:30 a.m.
